techmeme.title: Adani Group and Tower Semiconductor plan to invest ~$10B for a chip plant in Maharashtra, India; the plant will have an initial capacity of 40K wafers per month (Reuters)
Airbnb says New York City's law on short-term rentals has had "predictable" outcomes one year later, as rent prices remain high and housing availability low (Amanda Hoover/Wired)
Threads is trading trust for growth via Meta's creator program, which pays people to post without disclosing, making users assume everyone is engagement farming (Ben Werdmuller/Werd I/O)
Sources: Qualcomm has explored acquiring portions of Intel's design business, including Intel's client PC design business, as Intel struggles to generate cash (Reuters)
A look at Honor's AI defocus tech, which aims to solve myopia and is available on the new Honor MagicPad 2 tablet and Honor Magic V3 foldable phone (Nicholas Sutrich/Android Central)
